graph

Class DirectedAcyclicGraph<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.DirectedAcyclicGraph<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph<T>, NavigableGraph<T>, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class DirectedAcyclicGraph<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph<T>, NavigableGraph<T>, java.lang.Cloneable

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectedAcyclicGraph()
      Creates and empty graphs
      DirectedAcyclicGraph(java.util.Collection<? extends T> ts)
      Constructs a graph initialized with the nodes in the collection ts and zero edges.
      DirectedAcyclicGraph(T[] ts)
      Constructs a graph initialized with the nodes in the array ts and zero edges.

      • addEdge

        public int addEdge(java.util.List<? extends T> srcNodes,
          java.util.List<? extends T> destNodes)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Adds multiple edges to the graph. The indexes of the nodes of the lists are used to match the edge to be added. If one of the list is bigger then the other, the nodes wth no match are not considered.
        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        srcNodes - first list of nodes
        destNodes - second list of nodes
        Returns:
        the number of edges added to the graph
